measured_by: Lottery task estimating number of red balls in an urn
justification: In the lottery task, participants saw different payoffs and were asked “How many red balls do you think are in the basket?”; their answers served as their probability estimates, allowing researchers to capture beliefs about the risk-reward relationship.

topic_or_construct: Beliefs about probability of obtaining apartment types
measured_by: Apartment probability estimation task across five apartment quality levels
justification: In the apartment study, participants “were asked to judge the probability of obtaining each of the five apartment types under five ecological conditions,” so their stated probabilities operationalized their beliefs about the risk-reward structure in that context.
